text:
Hej!
I've implemented a web application on Windows 2000 plaform.  My web.xml file 
contains the following :

<servlet>
  <servlet-name>control</servlet-name>
  <display-name>centralServlet</display-name>
  <description>no description</description>
  <servlet-class>com.prosoft.npas.control.web.MainServlet</servlet-class>
 </servlet>
 <servlet-mapping>
  <servlet-name>control</servlet-name>
  <url-pattern>/control/*</url-pattern>
 </servlet-mapping>

Under Windows I can start my application by giving the pathname "control" (it 
then triggers MainServlet). 
However when I implemented the application on a Unix platform
"control" is not recognised anymore.

Any ideas?

Jonathan
creator: jonathan.a.ballantyne@telia.se
Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
I assume that Version=3.1.1 is accurate.  What you describe should work.
However, in 3.1.x, URL pattern matching was case insensive on case insensitive
file systems such as that in Windows.  This could allow things to work
in a case insensitive environment which wouldn't in a case sensitive environment
such as Unix.  This was fixed in Tomcat 3.2.x.

Since no active develompent is occuring in 3.1.x, I'm marking this bug as
WONTFIX.  I highly recommend you upgrade to Tomcat 3.2.3, or perhaps Tomcat 3.3.
Both have fixes for a number of security vulnerabilities which are still
present in 3.1.1.
